active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the security trade-offs of using POST vs. Artifact binding in SAML SP implementations. How do these choices impact replay protection and user privacy in enterprise SSO? Reference real-world examples like Okta integrations.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in SAML Service Provider (SP) under Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 001_Cryptography > 001_Cryptographic Protocols > 011_007_Federated Identity and Single Sign-On Protocols > SAML > SAML SP. Incorporate these pedagogical elements: - Learning Objectives: [REMEMBER: Define... CREATE: Design...] (as listed above). - Active Learning: Embed links to discussion (e.g., binding trade-offs), peer teaching (flows), problem-solving (troubleshooting). - Scaffolding: Layer 1 Foundation (terms, prereqs: SAML basics/TLS/sigs), Layer 2 Components (flows/bindings), Layer 3 Implementation (config/validation/best practices: sigs, audience/issuer/exp, XML attacks), Layer 4 Integration (multi-protocol/zero-trust/real-world: Okta/Shibboleth). - Big Picture: Secure federation in crypt protocols for SSO/zero-trust. Use research context: SP relies on IdP for auth via SAML 2.0 assertions (OASIS); SSO/federation; bindings (POST/Artifact). Generate flashcards per schema: - Structure: {'front': question, 'back': {'answer': correct/concise, 'explanation': detailed w/ rationale/real-world/best prac/prereq link, 'distractors': [3 for MCQ, plausible errors], 'references': {'layer':1-4, 'blooms':'REMEMBER', 'hierarchy':'full path'}, 'active_learning_link':'e.g., discussion prompt'}}. - Rules: 40-60 cards, balanced by layer/Bloom's (20% L1 Remember/Understand, etc.), 50% MCQ, vary types. Distractors from misconceptions (SP=auth? No, consumes), gaps (no sig val), research. Output ONLY a JSON array of flashcard objects. Ensure university-level: active recall, spaced repetition optimized, measurable.
